metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5705 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
apache2/modsecurity.c in ModSecurity before 2.7.6 allows remote attackersto bypass rules by using chunked transfer coding with a capitalized Chunkedvalue in the Transfer-Encoding HTTP header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-security2 - 2.7.7-2
libapache2-modsecurity - 2.7.7-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: modsecurity-apache package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.7-2').
